Articles.Content: Yeah, I was there for all of it. Pretty neat watching it be made.

Yeah, I was there for all of it. Pretty neat watching it be made.
so was I man. I was bananatime101. but I was switching to my laptop and the stream was finished.

Got some done with the MAV today

http://i.imgur.com/8ywJbdC.png

http://i.imgur.com/ISVuHkN.png

Way cool. Wish I could have tuned in. Have any screen caps of all the separated stages, or are you not quite to that stage yet?

Way cool. Wish I could have tuned in. Have any screen caps of all the separated stages, or are you not quite to that stage yet?

I see what you did there.

Way cool. Wish I could have tuned in. Have any screen caps of all the separated stages, or are you not quite to that stage yet?

Thanks man

(not final)

So are the clamps gonna make the fuel?

- - - Updated - - -

Also are their two stages?
That's awesome! Great job dude!

So are the clamps gonna make the fuel?

- - - Updated - - -

Also are their two stages?

The boxy thing that is in the structural part is the fuel plant. The large engines are the descent engines for when it gets dropped off. There are technically 3 stages. Descent, Ascent 1, Ascent 2, and then the command pod.

Thanks man

http://i.imgur.com/TaUbk2R.png

(not final)

Wow. Nicely done. If I understand correctly from the film, the three main descent engines remain on the ground with the fuel plant, and there are a bunch of radial engines on the tapered core that do the lifting on ascent. I've tried to replicate in KSP with little luck. It's really hard to get good shots of the MAV, especially of the core stage. It's difficult to tell how many radial engines are on the MAV core, but there are at least greater than five I believe. I'm not sure how accurate you're planning on going with this, but that's what I know about the MAV.

Will the capsule be of similar design to the MDV capsule?

Wow. Nicely done. If I understand correctly from the film, the three main descent engines remain on the ground with the fuel plant, and there are a bunch of radial engines on the tapered core that do the lifting on ascent. I've tried to replicate in KSP with little luck. It's really hard to get good shots of the MAV, especially of the core stage. It's difficult to tell how many radial engines are on the MAV core, but there are at least greater than five I believe. I'm not sure how accurate you're planning on going with this, but that's what I know about the MAV.

Will the capsule be of similar design to the MDV capsule?

This is correct, as far as I know.

Thanks man

http://i.imgur.com/TaUbk2R.png

(not final)

That looks amazing! Keep up the good work!
Aww man, they ran out of tickets At least I got a pic of him from the outside

Aww man, they ran out of tickets At least I got a pic of him from the outside

http://i.imgur.com/csqi51e.jpg

Cool!
I feel like they should have gone the Kerbal way and shoved everyone in there.
Am I the only one who finds the Hermes to be unnecessarily big?

Am I the only one who finds the Hermes to be unnecessarily big?

Well, you'll change your mind after flying to Mars in Hitchhiker, with 3 other guys.

Am I the only one who finds the Hermes to be unnecessarily big?

Absolutely. not necessarily diameter but length, it could use the same pieces and rotating ring but it should be half the length IMO

Am I the only one who finds the Hermes to be unnecessarily big?
Yes. But it is still awesome!
What's the capacity of the cockpit of the hermes?

What's the capacity of the cockpit of the hermes?

6 kerbals

Oh duh. R I ttly smrt.

Can't wait to see what's up next
One thing I havent been able to work out, how did they cancel out the torque-reaction from that single rotating ring? Two counter-rotating rings would do it easily, and provide moar room IMHO

One thing I havent been able to work out, how did they cancel out the torque-reaction from that single rotating ring? Two counter-rotating rings would do it easily, and provide moar room IMHO

Computer-controlled weights in the arms. Probably.

Sorry guys no stream today, got lots of stuff to study on.

Textured the panels (the black part in the middle is transparent, wont show up in game)

Any idea on a ETA ?
